sentence.text: Dysfunction of the cerebral glucose transporter GLUT1 (encoded by protein-containing complex assembly) is known to result in epilepsy, intellectual disability (ID), and movement disorder.

Using whole-exome sequencing, we identified rare homozygous missense variants (c.526CAAAAT [p.Arg176Trp] and c.629CAAAAT [p.Ala210Val]) in glucose transmembrane transport, encoding another cerebral glucose transporter, in two consanguineous multiplex families with moderate to severe ID, epilepsy, and variable neuropsychiatric features.
All together, our data strongly suggest that recessive mutations in glucose transmembrane transport cause ID and epilepsy.
Dysfunction of the cerebral glucose transporter GLUT1 (encoded by protein-containing complex assembly) is known to result in epilepsy, intellectual disability (ID), and movement disorder.
